name: Abomination Vaults: Addons
caption: Abomination Vaults - Addons Journals, Actors, etc.
description:
Welcome to the Abomination Vaults: Addons.

After importing this look at the Abomination Vaults: Addons document for more information on the module features.

You can support me (Chasarooni, the compile of most of these changes as well as the primary developer on the code/animations in this module) below

description.value: @Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Lifesense]

Trigger A creature in the swarm's space attempts to Cast a Spell with a verbal component or attempts an action with the linguistic or vocal traits

Effect The swarming hands clamp over the triggering creature's mouth, preventing it from vocalizing. The affected creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:22] save or the triggering action is disrupted.
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.NegativeHealing]

Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[3d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true]). A creature that fails its save against Pummeling Grasp is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]

The cave worm recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

Frequency once per day

Trigger The cave worm would be affected by a condition or adverse effect (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis})

Effect The cave worm negates the triggering condition or effect by sloughing an outer layer of its skin. Effects from artifacts, deities, or a similarly powerful source can't be avoided in this way.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage, and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Trigger The cave worm @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabs} a creature.

Effect The worm uses Swallow Whole.

The purple worm can violently regurgitate a creature or boulder it has swallowed to make a ranged Strike. The Strike deals bludgeoning damage depending on the size of the projectile:

  • Tiny @Damage[(2d6+13)[bludgeoning]]{2d6+13}
  • Small @Damage[(3d6+13)[bludgeoning]]{3d6+13}
  • Medium @Damage[(4d6+13)[bludgeoning]]{4d6+13}
  • Large @Damage[(5d6+13)[bludgeoning]]{5d6+13}
  • Huge @Damage[(6d6+13)[bludgeoning]]{6d6+13}

A regurgitated creature takes falling damage from the height of the target or from 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Boulders occupy space in the worm's stomach as a creature of equivalent size, and purple worms often have several boulders swallowed. A purple worm can use a single action to swallow a new boulder.

@UUID[Macro.X28HKDQaNJxl4fci]{Regurgitate Animation}
A cave worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

Huge, @Damage[(3d6+9)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 24

@UUID[Item.7xKOXwUKrcg8gD3y]{Effect: Swallowed Whole (Cave Worm)}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

The worm makes a Strike once against each creature in its reach. It can Strike up to once with its jaws, up to once with its stinger, and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ImprovedGrab]
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.NegativeHealing]

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

details.publicNotes: This Cave worm was Belcorra's Pet Worm from @UUID[JournalEntry.uMZ0RiCcPSqsx1Nm.JournalEntryPage.8pbhSFgv71lvCz9M]{B35. Gauntlight Basement}.
details.privateNotes: Note: This assumes you own the Pathfinder Monster Core module to display the art

details.disable:
The haunt can be disabled in one of three ways:

  • Four @Check[religion|dc:21] (trained) checks to banish the spectral image of Belcorra.

  • Two @Check[deception|dc:26] (trained) checks to goad this shard, which is infused with a minute portion of Belcorra's essence, into a fury, shattering its focus.

  • One @Check[athletics|dc:31] (expert) check to smash the mirror's magical structure, permanently shattering it.
details.description: The reflection in the mirror subtly twists and distorts, its expression taking on an unnerving sneer of malice. It is the image of a beautiful but cruel-looking woman with blood-flecked lips and hands that look closer to claws.
details.reset: The haunt re-forms after 1 minute unless it has been disabled.
details.routine:
(2 actions)

The haunt uses the Become The Experiment action.

description.value:
Trigger A living creature steps into any square that is directly in line with the mirror or adjacent to it.

Effect Shadowy tendrils impale the body of the creature as the haunt makes a blood sample Strike.

A creature hit by the reflection's blood sample must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save as the haunt tries to draw a portion of its vital essence into the mirror. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} on a failed saving throw, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure.

Effect The image of the Ghost Queen, Belcorra, whispers in your mind, compelling you to submit to the experiments of her servants. The haunt deals @Damage[(2d10+9)[mental]] damage to a single non-unholy creature in the room. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, and gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition for 1 round, driven to take one of the ladders down the east hatch.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage. It also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition for 1 minute, driven to take one of the ladders down the east hatch.

Requirements The will-o'-wisp swarm is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{invisible}

Effect The will-o'-wisp swarm reveals itself, losing its invisibility for 1 round. Each creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] must make a @Check[will|dc:26] save.

Regardless of their result, the targets become immune to Horrifying Visage for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.
Failure The creature takes @Damage[5d8[mental]] damage, and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.
Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d8[mental]] damage, and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.
description.gm: Players who have played the Adventure Path Abomination Vaults treat their character's degree of success as one degree worse than their roll.

description.value: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[5d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save).

Frequency once per round

Requirements An enemy within 30 feet is under a fear effect or dying

Effect The will-o'-wisp feeds on the creature's terror. It regains @Damage[4d4[healing]]{4d4 Hit Points}, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites.

The will-o'-wisp extinguishes its glow, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its Shocking Swarm while invisible, the arcs of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the will-o'-wisp only @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to all observers until it moves.
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AllAroundVision]
@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwarmMind]

40 feet.

A will-o'-wisp is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a colored light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

A will-o'-wisp swarm is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}.

Falsehoods pass your lips as smoothly as silk. You gain a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} and against Perception checks to discern if you are telling the truth, and you add your level even if untrained. If the implausibility of your lies prompts a circumstance penalty or a DC increase, reduce that penalty by half or increase it by half.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.6vodhSeI3ClMfOGd]{Spell Effect: Honeyed Words}

You afflict the target with a curse that makes its presence abrasive and off-putting. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success For 10 minutes, the target must roll twice and use the worse result whenever attempting a Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, or Performance check, and creatures they encounter have an initial attitude toward them of one step worse (for instance, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.I1ffBVISxLr2gC4u]{Unfriendly} instead of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent}).

Failure As success, but the effect is permanent.

Critical Failure As failure, and creatures that the target encounters have an initial attitude toward them of two steps worse.

Your honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. You suggest a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be self-destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and knows you tried to control it.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target immediately follows your suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

Critical Failure As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

Your words fascinate your targets. You speak or sing without interruption throughout the casting and duration. Targets who notice your speech or song might give their undivided attention; each target must attempt a Will save. The GM might grant a circumstance bonus (to a maximum of +4) if the target is of an opposing religion, ancestry, or political leaning, or is otherwise unlikely to agree with what you're saying.

Each creature that comes within range has to attempt a save when you Sustain the spell. If you're speaking, enthrall gains the linguistic trait.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and notices that you tried to use magic.

Success The target needn't pay attention but doesn't notice you tried to use magic (it might notice others are enthralled).

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with you. It can attempt another Will save if it witnesses actions or speech with which it disagrees. If it succeeds, it's no longer fascinated and is temporarily immune for 1 hour. If the target is subject to a hostile act, or if another creature succeeds at a Diplomacy or Intimidation check against it, the fascination ends immediately.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target can't attempt a save to end the fascination if it disagrees with you.

With a cursory mental touch, you attempt to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to your mind reading for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target perceives vague surface thoughts from you when you Cast the Spell.

Success You find out whether the target's Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Failure You perceive vague surface thoughts from the target when you Cast the Spell, and you find out whether its Intelligence is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

Critical Failure As failure, and for the duration of the spell, you can Sustain the spell to detect the target's surface thoughts again. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

duration.value: 1 round or sustained up to 1 minute

description.value:
You forcibly calm creatures in the area, soothing them into a nonviolent state; each creature must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success Calming urges impose a -1 status penalty to the creature's attack rolls.

Failure Any emotion effects that would affect the creature are suppressed and the creature can't use hostile actions. If the target is subject to hostility from any other creature, it ceases to be affected by calm.

Critical Failure As failure, but hostility doesn't end the effect.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Qr5rgoZvI4KmFY0N]{Spell Effect: Calm}

The target is overtaken with uncontrollable laughter. It must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is plagued with uncontrollable laughter. It can't use reactions.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Critical Failure The target falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and can't use actions or reactions for 1 round. It then takes the effects of a failure.

You dull the target's mind, depending on its Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the start of your next turn.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for 1 minute.

Blessings from beyond help your companions strike true. You and your allies gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls while within the emanation. Once per round on subsequent turns, you can Sustain the spell to increase the emanation's radius by 10 feet.

Bless can counteract @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7ZinJNzxq0XF0oMx]{Bane}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.RfCEHpMoEAZvB9IZ]{Aura: Bless}

target.value: you and allies in the area

description.value:
You push into the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals 1d6 mental damage, with a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]{Invisibility Potion}) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

Tendrils of darkness curl out from your fingertips and race through the air. You deal 2d4 void damage and @Damage[(@item.level)[bleed]] damage to living creatures in the line. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half the void damage and no persistent bleed damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double void damage and double persistent bleed damage.

Heightened (+1) The void damage increases by 2d4, and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

You ask for the guidance of supernatural entities, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3qHKBDF7lrHw8jFK]{Spell Effect: Guidance}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3LyOkV25p7wA181H]{Effect: Guidance Immunity}

duration.value: until the start of your next turn

description.value:
You create an illusion that causes the target to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds). The disguise is typically good enough to hide their identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell changes their appearance and voice, but not mannerisms. You can change the appearance of its clothing and worn items, such as making its armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item removed from the creature returns to its true appearance.

Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties the target might take for disguising itself as a dissimilar creature, gives a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through the disguise, and lets the target add its level to such Deception checks even if untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

Heightened (3rd) The target can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to replicate its appearance, and must have heard its voice to replicate its voice.

Heightened (4th) You can target up to 10 willing creatures. If you target multiple creatures, you can choose a different disguise for each target, but none can impersonate a specific individual. You can Dismiss each disguise individually or all collectively.

Heightened (7th) As 4th, but you can choose disguises that impersonate specific individuals. You must have seen an individual to replicate its appearance, and must have heard its voice to replicate its voice.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3Ktyd5F9lOPo4myk]{Spell Effect: Illusory Disguise}

The target's latch mechanism clinks shut, held fast by unseen magical wards. When you magically lock a target, you set an Athletics and Thievery DC to open it equal to your spell DC or the base lock DC with a +4 status bonus, whichever is higher. Any key or combination that once opened a lock affected by this spell does not do so for the duration of the spell, though the key or combination does grant a +4 circumstance bonus to checks to open the door. If the target is opened, the spell ends. Assuming the target is not barred or locked in some additional way, you can unlock and open it with an Interact action during which you touch the target. This does not end the spell. You can Dismiss this spell at any time and from any distance.

Heightened (2nd) The duration is unlimited, but you must expend 6 gp worth of precious metals as an additional cost.

target.value: 1 lock, or a door or container with a latch

description.value: You summon a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.j7NNPfZwD19BwSEZ]{Phantasmal Minion}. The minion is roughly the shape of a humanoid. You can choose to have it be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} or have an ephemeral appearance, but it's obviously a magical effect, not a real creature.

You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. You can use the spell's reaction to reduce damage from any spell or magical effect, even if it doesn't deal physical damage. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (+2) The shield's Hardness increases by 5.

duration.value: until the start of your next turn

description.value:
You call upon the Void to harm life force. The target takes 2d4 void damage with a basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the start of your next turn.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

Trigger The cult leader is targeted with an attack, and a lower-ranking cultist is adjacent to them

Effect The cult leader orders their cultist to leap in front of the attack. The cultist and cult leader swap places, and the cultist becomes the target of the attack. If the cultist has Fanatical Frenzy or a similar ability, they can activate it as a reaction if they take damage from the triggering attack.

With a short emotional phrase, the cult leader tries to sway the public to do their bidding. The cult leader tries to convince up to four bystanders in a crowd to cause a commotion, turn against a person or group, leave the area, protect the cult leader, or calm down. The cult leader attempts a single @Check[deception|against:perception] check against the highest Perception DC among the targets.

Critical Success The targets believe the lie and act as directed for 1 minute. Additionally, one bystander remains by the cult leader's side, influenced enough to join the cult. All other targets become wise to the cult leader after 1 minute, at which point their attitude toward the leader worsens by one step.

Success As a critical success, but no bystander joins the cult permanently.

Critical Failure The crowd is unmoved and unamused, and their attitude toward the cult leader worsens by one step.

items.name: Cult Lore (applies to the leader's own cult)

description.value: This weapon consists of a wooden handle attached to a spiked ball or cylinder by a chain, rope, or strap of leather.

Trigger A creature within range becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}

You open your mouth wide and inhale sharply; you draw in the bravery, self-confidence, and hope to which the frightened target clings and then strip away the target's false assumption that these fragile emotions can save them from the oblivion of terror. You deal 6d4 mental damage to the creature, which must attempt a Will saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage; you regain Hit Points equal to half the damage the target takes.

Critical Failure The creature's frightened condition increases by 1 (to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}) and it takes double damage; you regain Hit Points equal to half the damage the target takes.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

With a wave of the hand, you cause all creatures in the area to see the world around them as if a gauzy film had been lifted away to expose the truth that lies below their perceived reality. Natural features they can see grow twisted and horrendous, structures appear distorted and ruined, and objects seem warped and alien. This alternate vision fades quickly, but the glimpse beyond the natural world lingers for the spell's duration.

Aberrations or worshippers of Outer Gods or Great Old Ones are bolstered by this vision of warped reality and gain a +1 status bonus to Will saving throws and attack rolls for 1 minute, while all other creatures must attempt a Will saving throw.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.ihv1azg80N3kj7Vo]{Spell Effect: Lift Nature's Caul (Bonus)}

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is stupefied 1 for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. It can't reduce the value of its frightened condition below 1 as long as it remains stupefied by this spell.

Heightened (+2) The area increases by 5 feet.

Requirements You can bleed.

Trigger A creature deals piercing, slashing, or persistent bleed damage to you.

You curse the target, punishing it for having the audacity to spill your blood. The target takes 2d6 persistent bleed damage and must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half the persistent bleed damage.

Failure The target takes the full persistent bleed damage. Until the bleeding stops, the target has weakness 1 to piercing and slashing damage. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.buXx8Azr4BYWPtFg]{Spell Effect: Blood Vendetta (Failure)}

Critical Failure As failure, but the target takes double the persistent bleed damage.

Heightened (+2) The persistent bleed damage increases by 2d6.

You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

details.publicNotes:
A career of mystical accomplishments combined with a lifetime of subterfuge and intimidation has elevated this occultist to a powerful position.

Hidden secrets and occult powers have an irresistible lure for many. Since the majority of these NPCs are spellcasters, consider using alternative spell lists to adjust their themes.

description.value: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

items.name: Will +2 vs. Higher Ranking Members of the Cult

description.value:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a 2 penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is fatigued.

items.name: Cult Lore (for the cultist's own cult)

description.value: This weapon consists of a wooden handle attached to a spiked ball or cylinder by a chain, rope, or strap of leather and appears to be of shoddy make.

allSaves.value: (Will +2 vs. higher-ranking members of the cult)

details.publicNotes: Hidden secrets and occult powers have an irresistible lure for many. Since the majority of these NPCs are spellcasters, consider using alternative spell lists to adjust their themes.

will.saveDetail: (or +2 vs. higher-ranking members of the cult)

description.value: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.
A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.
A monster hunter specializes in bringing down certain creatures. These favored game are those that have recently eaten meat in the last few hours.

Trigger A creature within your reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

You lash out at a foe that leaves an opening. Make a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If your attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, you disrupt that action. This Strike doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

Frequency once per hour

Requirements The monster hunter isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}

Effect The monster hunter leads an attack against their monstrous foe. The monster hunter chooses an enemy they can see that qualifies as their favored game. The monster hunter becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by that creature and gains 10 temporary Hit Points that last as long as the onslaught does. During the onslaught, the hunter gains a +8 status bonus to damage rolls against the designated enemy, and allies in a 30-foot aura around the hunter gain half that bonus. The onslaught lasts for 1 minute or until either the nhimbaloth hunter or the designated creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.

When the monster hunter hits a creature that qualifies as their favored game, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical hit).
The monster hunter Strides twice and makes a melee Strike.
This large flail has a long shaft connected to a shorter piece of stout wood or metal that's sometimes inlaid with spikes.
A Nhimbaloth Hunter automatically knows wheter a creature it sees qualifies as its Favored Game, and has a +4 status bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} them.

This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol can be worn on the body on a chain or pin, or can be held.

details.publicNotes:
These Nhimbaloth "Hunters" have grown past the minor pursuits of other hunters and they seek the most dangerous game, men. They hunt car nviores who have recently eaten a meat

Modified from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-npc-core.3qDYEHtyAobpCg5r]{Monster Hunter}

description.gm: What I felt was no ordinary ghostly fear. It was infinitely greater, stranger, and seemed to arise from some dim ancestral sense of terror more profoundly disturbing than anything I had known or dreamed of. To be carried over the border and deprived of what I called "my life," yet by mental, not physical, processes! A radical alteration, a complete change, a horrible loss of oneself by substitutionthe emptiest of deaths.
description.value:
Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:33|showDC:gml|traits:curse,auditory,illusion,magical,mental,visual]{Will save}

TimelineAbomination Vaults Book 3

Suggested Triggers Entering any area consecrated to Nhimbaloth, or during the initial @JournalEntry[Abomination Vaults#Belcorra Attacks]{Belcorra Attacks!} encounter

Curse | Auditory | Illusion | Magical | Mental | Visual

Your Lot, To Die
So close to the unspeakable horror of Nhimbaloth's realm, you can no longer distinguish friend from foe, reason from madness, or even life from death.

Stage 1 You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. At the start of your first turn in combat, you take @Damage[(4d6)[slashing]]{4d6 slashing damage} that cannot be prevented in any way. Also, whenever you take slashing damage, you must succeed at the curse save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}. (1 day)

Stage 2You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. At the start of your first turn in combat, you take @Damage[(6d6)[slashing]]{6d6 slashing damage} that cannot be prevented in any way. Also, whenever you take slashing damage, you must succeed at the curse save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. (1 day)

Stage 3You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. At the start of your first turn in combat, you take @Damage[(8d6)[slashing]]{8d6 slashing damage} that cannot be prevented in any way. Also, whenever you take slashing damage, you must succeed at the curse save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}. (1 day)

Stage 4You die, and your spirit is consumed by the Empty Death.

publication.title: PF2e Foundry Discord: Abomination Vaults Thread

description.gm: The ongoing effect of investigating the machinations of Nhimbaloth and her servants moves from the realm of sleep to your waking moments. Ominous cracks in the fabric of reality appear before your eyes, fraying the edges of your sanity. You are no longer certain of who your friends are.
description.value:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|showDC:gm|]{Will save}

Timeline Abomination Vaults Book 2

Trigger Any encounter with Belcorra, her most powerful servants, or areas consecrated to Nhimbaloth

Curse | Illusion | Magical | Mental | Auditory | Visual

The Wisp, Her Eye

Stage 1 At the start of any encounter, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}. You can attempt the standard DC 11 flat check to remove the confused condition, but a success only disables the condition until the next encounter. (1 day)

Stage 2 At the start of any encounter, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}.You can attempt a DC 15 flat check to remove the confused condition, but a success only disables the condition until the next encounter. (1 day)

Stage 3 You become a permanent servant of the Empty Death, leaving your adventuring group to seek out the deepest reaches of the Gauntlight Ruins and assist the denizens there in in their vile plans.

publication.title: PF2e Foundry Discord: Abomination Vaults Thread

description.gm: Outside there was a sound of multitudinous little patterings. They had been coming, I was aware, for a long time, and in my sleep they had first become audible. I sat there nervously wide awake as though I had not slept at all. It seemed to me that my breathing came with difficulty, and that there was a great weight upon the surface of my body.
description.value:
Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:20|showDC:gm|traits:curse,illusion,magical,mental,auditory]

Timeline Abomination Vaults floors A through C

Suggested Triggers Contact with the shrine altar on floor A, or the first time a character moves into the ribbon of light in @JournalEntry[B: Servants' Quarters#B35. Gauntlight Basement]{B35} or @JournalEntry[C: Library#C15. Gauntlight Reading Room]{C15}

Curse | Illusion | Magical | Mental | Auditory

The Wind, Her Voice

Even the briefest of encounters with dread Nhimbaloth's presence is enough to affect the health of the unwary. This curse causes you to hear whispering voices, footsteps, and other odd noises during your next long rest. If left untreated, the loss of sleep starts to take a toll on your wellbeing.

Stage 1 You must rest for 12 hours instead of 8 to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. (1 day)

Stage 2 As stage 1, and you can't gain any benefit from resting or long-term rest. (1 day)

Stage 3 As stage 2, and you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}. (1 day)

publication.title: PF2e Foundry Discord: Abomination Vaults Thread

description.value:
Huge, @Damage[(3d6+9)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 24

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

items.name: Effect:  The Bonds that Give us Strength

description.value:
The NPC aids in your check giving you either an untyped bonus of:

  • +1 - Something the NPC wouldn't really be proficient in (IE Carman in Religion)

  • +2 - Something the NPC would be proficient in (IE Morliblint and Arcana)

  • +3 - If you share an especially close bond with the NPC (their presence inspires you)

text.content:
Sourced from @weepingminotaur.

Minor Curse - The Wind, Her Voice

@UUID[Item.ZCmQhpzHnxCmXylz]{Nhimbaloth - Minor Curse}
Even the briefest of encounters with dread Nhimbaloth's presence is enough to affect the health of the unwary. This curse causes you to hear whispering voices, footsteps, and other odd noises during your next long rest. If left untreated, the loss of sleep starts to take a toll on your wellbeing.

  • Timeline Abomination Vaults floors A through C

  • Suggested Triggers Contact with the shrine altar on floor A, or the first time a character moves into the ribbon of light in @JournalEntry[B: Servants' Quarters#B35. Gauntlight Basement]{B35} or @JournalEntry[C: Library#C15. Gauntlight Reading Room]{C15}

Moderate Curse - The Wisp, Her Eye

@UUID[Item.Xc13QNzVsZToAs7o]{Nhimbaloth - Moderate Curse}

The ongoing effect of investigating the machinations of Nhimbaloth and her servants moves from the realm of sleep to your waking moments. Ominous cracks in the fabric of reality appear before your eyes, fraying the edges of your sanity. You are no longer certain of who your friends are.

  • Timeline Abomination Vaults Book 2

  • Trigger Any encounter with Belcorra, her most powerful servants, or areas consecrated to Nhimbaloth. In addition, the party and any other allies travelling with them are exposed to the curse at 7am and 7pm every day (to correspond with the 7 arms of Nhimbaloth).

Major Curse - Your Lot, To Die

@UUID[Item.CyWfBIXA8CKVFMK4]{Nhimbaloth - Major Curse}

So close to the unspeakable horror of Nhimbaloth's realm, you can no longer distinguish friend from foe, reason from madness, or even life from death.

  • Timeline Abomination Vaults Book 3

  • Suggested Triggers Entering any area consecrated to Nhimbaloth, or during the initial @JournalEntry[Abomination Vaults#Belcorra Attacks]{Belcorra Attacks!} encounter. In addition, the party and any other allies travelling with them are exposed to the curse at 7am and 7pm every day (to correspond with the 7 arms of Nhimbaloth).

This module consists of misc changes and addons for Abomination Vaults. This in some ways is an amalgamation of advice and ideas created, as always pick and choose what to use in your games.

Table of Contents

  • @UUID[.hOMUDNapQMRjV1kQ]{Nhimbaloth Curses}

  • @UUID[.IEochnYWMkLR8UNU]{Animations}

Misc

  • @UUID[Macro.l1nf3CAxWQpWtos6]{Belcorra Attacks} - Animation for @UUID[JournalEntry.3T1M395V6J75OsEp.JournalEntryPage.em5wJ44hCXP8mGGG]{Belcorra Attacks} that either makes Belcorra appear flying in from the side, or if you have Belcorra's token selected and hidden will run the animation on that Belcorra

  • @UUID[Macro.XoRI9jJBmsh26uQV]{Nhimbaloth's Presence} - Animation that covers the players' screens with tentacles to show Nhimbaloth's presence

  • @UUID[Macro.AA6MqMXNiSe1YgIr]{Nhimbaloth's Symbol} - Animation to display Nhimbaloth's symbol to indicate something Nhimbaloth Adjacent

Floor 4

  • @UUID[Macro.PkE3U7qHg7NBniJW]{Destroy the Barrier} - Animation of the Barrier being destroyed

Floor 10

  • @UUID[Macro.W1QOzaP485TKNJQi]{10 - Belcorra Death} - Animation of Nhimbaloth consuming Belcorra after the Party uses the Lenses on her

  • @UUID[Macro.3IWW7fvMRghHzikg]{10 - Gauntlight Collapses} - Animation for the Gauntlight Collapsing

Remember that giant dead cave worm in room @UUID[JournalEntry.uMZ0RiCcPSqsx1Nm.JournalEntryPage.8pbhSFgv71lvCz9M]{B35. Gauntlight Basement}.

Well for the finale @UUID[Actor.wX2jNFncThTLvG9F]{Belcorra's Cave Worm} is back and ghostlier than ever, also rocking a cool new Fly Speed, and a cool animation see its Regurgitate.

Use her pet cave worm to replace the Soul Feeders that originally accompany Belcorra in her final stand.

Added the following maps to facilitate running perhaps a burning of the log fume. The intention is to be a tower further to the north where logs are loaded into the fume before they make it all the way down to The Giant's Wheel.

The Down Hill scene provides a cool opportunity for you to have an encounter while riding on logs down the flume (I recommend looking at opportunities in AV:E's Consortium Conspiracy specifically @UUID[JournalEntry.2hfULzZn5NL03aDy.JournalEntryPage.EyBtkejRJ5WGQzxT]{The Loading Flume Fire}.

@UUID[Compendium.abomination-vaults-addons.abomination-vaults-addons-scenes.Scene.fPV3dl3eqn0Hv71q]{Log Flume | Down Hill}

@UUID[Compendium.abomination-vaults-addons.abomination-vaults-addons-scenes.Scene.85cpyV5nRl1cIGcd]{Log Flume | Loading Tower}

Add a macro to add the Lever Puzzle mentioned in @UUID[JournalEntry.yn21bNM6kpV4xRol.JournalEntryPage.1Ov1191GpaTDBaAE]{J15. Deadly Swamp} (credit to @darkim for much of the original implementation)

You'll need the Tagger and Monk's Active Tiles modules for this to function, but simply run the @UUID[Macro.btHyWcte8PX6Omgz]{J15. Add Lever Puzzle} macro, and Voila!

To interact with the levers you'll need a selected token nearby, and then Right Click it.

Add a macro to add little helper indicator drawings to parts of the maps that were unclear as well as adding in some height clarifications for certain height drop offs to see on the fly. These are all interface drawings only visible to the GM.
@UUID[Macro.sb4hhwJqMfJCjuAR]{Helper Drawing Setup Dialog}

This is a pretty lengthy addition for the end of the Abomination Vaults adventure, involving one last set piece "The Gauntlight" rushing to attack the town one last time. The goal of this is to be one last set piece, and it takes place when the party is most likely drained of resource or at least low after the Belcorra fight.

(Setup macro to setup your @UUID[Scene.lQkXSdxvO9CRxohD]{Otari Map} for this Encounter @UUID[Macro.7g27xSMFTUSYiqHe]{Setup: Gauntlight's Revenge})

The premise

After the players have slain Belcorra banished her to be fed to her Ancient God and escaped the collapsing Gauntlight, there is left behind a large amount of latent necromantic energy from Nhimbaloth. As the party existed the Vaults, describe them seeing a ghostly glowing beam rise out of the hole where the tower was as 6 more rise to join it raising up the Gauntlight, support by 7 ghostly legs (think the Guardians from Zelda BoTW). The Gauntlight then begins (powered by this energy and vague desire to consume souls) rush its way towards the town of Otari.

Handling Dead PCs

After the party escapes the Gauntlight's collapse, and makes it back to the surface, you might have lost a PC or two along the way, if so, and you don't want to have those players sit out the following scene, I recommend giving those characters the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.52nzskpmUt9AjUf8]{Ghost Dedication}, and specifying that their spirit seems to have been temporary tied to this area due to where they were killed. (Similar to the Roseguard, also under similar implication that the servants of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.QZD0u1jxwz0kj8uI]{Pharasma} will come to escort them beyond when their final task is done)

The Chase

The first element of this is a chase, IE the Gauntlight as it moves forward towards the town on its humungous Nhimbaloth empowered necromantic energy legs. While it is surprisingly more nimble than expected, it also lumbers slowly when it doesn't perceive a threat to conserve energy.

Chase Special Rules

The Chase will consist of 7 obstacles, each of which takes place over the long trek back to Otari.

In addition, the major element about this chase that is different from other chases, is that failing to clear an objective does not mean the party falls behind, they simply will not gain an opportunity to engage with and stop the tower (the Takedown phase) for that round. (If you wish for this to be a more difficult set piece, you can however I prefer to make sure the final set piece after along fight is something that my players can triumphantly engage with as a last Hurrah). But each round consists of a Chase phase and a Takedown phase (which will be explained below)

All Your Friends are back

This part generally relies on you having run the @UUID[JournalEntry.ZPTalN8eYZyKYfz0.JournalEntryPage.fKVTu0SPpNOMwRCJ]{Zarmavdian's Ritual} from Abomination Vaults: Expanded, if you chose not to run that for whatever reason and want this, perhaps have either Wrin have a premonition or see the Gauntlight's energy acting weird.

Either way, the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.5KstOkXabrOlZaKR]{nosoi} from the ritual has returned and brought friends. At the start of round 2, as a party member goes to either participate in the Chase phase or the Takedown phase, have a character whom the players have formed a bond or relationship with (or someone who would represent them if they say have people that serve them) show up to help!

When do they show?

  • As a player starts their turn in the Chase phase make a @Check[flat|dc:11] on a success, any remaining NPC they have a bond with shows up during the Chase phase, on a failure they are delayed and show up in the Takedown phase.

  • Note. Many NPCs may have a bond with multiple players, if that is the case they may show up for each player, however each NPC will only show once per player.

Helping Out

  • Non Fighting NPCs. Some NPC clearly do not have combat prowess (such as say Brelda Venkervale), if she would come to assist your player instead narrate either some Sailor, Guard, or other Town NPC that was spurred to action by them insisting to help

  • @UUID[Item.E0OKIog3W01BhtAB]{Effect: The Bonds that Give us Strength}

Help Bonus. The NPC aids in your check giving you either an untyped bonus of:

  • +1 - Something the NPC wouldn't really be proficient in (IE Carman in Religion)
    +2 - Something the NPC would be proficient in (IE Morliblint and Arcana)
    +3 - If you share an especially close bond with the NPC (their presence inspires you)

Chase Phase

The Chase phase functions as a normal Chase, the party will have to clear an obstacle set before them. If the obstacle is cleared before other player's turns they may instead take their turn in the Chase Phase to participate in the Takedown phase (they still get their normal turn in the takedown phase so this effectively an extra turn).

Chase Obstacles

Each obstacle unless otherwise noted requires # of players - 1 success to pass. (if you want to raise or lower the difficulty you can increase this count by 1 or lower by 1 respectively)

Predator's Gaze

Primal dread freezes your muscles as you feel an unseen horror watch over you

@Check[Occultism|dc:28] - Recognize the hunter's grip over your mind and deduct you way out of it

@Check[Will|dc:30] - Fight against the fear

@Check[Performance|dc:28] - Rally your allies

Sucking Mire

The bog below your feet impedes your progress, as you feel ghostly hands grasp to pull you under

@Check[Athletics|dc:30] - Fight against the pull

@Check[Acrobatics|dc:28] - Jump around over nearby debris

@Check[Arcana|dc:28] - Disrupt the ghostly pulling

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b5sGjGlBf58f8jn0]{Air Walk} or equivalent expenditure results in an instant critical success (if it is a free ability count as an instant normal success)

Swarm of Wisps

Hundreds of glowing orbs descend upon you from the Gauntlight like a mass of angry hornets

@Check[Occultism|dc:30] - Identify weak points in the swarm's formation

@Check[Religion|dc:28] - Wards them off with holy power

@Check[Athletics|dc:28] - Force your way through the mass of wisps

Mangled Forest

A mangled array of twisted trees lay across the ground, with a glowing moss beginning to grow upon the wreckage

@Check[Nature|dc:30] - Use your knowledge of nature to find a way to traverse the trees avoiding the moss

@Check[survival|dc:28] - Forge a path across the trees using your canniness

@Check[Acrobatics|dc:28] - Move your way through the trees using your reflexes

Haunted Fog

The fog stirs with the spirits of dead warriors, reenacting their final moments of a long dead battlefield

@Check[Performance|dc:30] - Act or Dance your way through the battlefield in time to the fog warriors

@Check[Intimidation|dc:30] - Assert your presence causing your ghostly foes to avoid you

@Check[Deception|dc:29] - Trick your ghostly foes into believing you are on their side

@Check[Society|dc:28] - Recall knowledge of the battle that took place here and use it to navigate the battlefield

Soul Trapping Puddles

Pools of water begin to form each flowing with spirits, as the sight of them pulls you towards them as they attack at you

@Check[Religion|dc:30] - Exorcise spirits as you travel

@Check[Diplomacy|dc:30] - Calm the spirits as your travel

@Check[Occultism|dc:30] - Follow the flow of necromatic energy to weave through

@Check[tealthS|dc:28] - Skulk through the area avoiding being attacked

Necrotic Bloom

The moss has begun to spread over the trees, covering the area in a memory stealing mist

@Check[Survival|dc:30] - Locate the quickest path through

@Check[Medicine|dc:30] - Find a quick counteracting agent to prevent the effects

@Check[Crafting|dc:28] - Neutralize the mist using alchemical Catalysts

Takedown Phase

During the takedown phase there are 2 two targets, the Legs and the Lenses (which float above the lighthouse). These both use the Victory Point system

The Legs

To take out the legs (and stop the tower from moving for a round, before it regrows its legs).

Note: You can click on the effect on the Gauntlight's Revenge token to toggle down the amount of legs visually

7 Victory Points (1 for each leg)

  • 3 VP Threshold (slowed down, lower the number of Chase Points needed by 1)

Relevant Checks

  • Attack rolls DC 32

  • @Check[athletics|dc:30] - To attack a leg

  • @Check[occultism|dc:28], @Check[arcana|dc:30], @Check[religion|dc:30], @Check[nature|dc:30] - Use knowledge of magic to disable it

The Lenses

To remove a lens from the area they float at above the Gauntlight, When all the lenses are removed or destroyed the encounter ends with the Gauntlight falling over onto the ground.

Note. A character can attempt to climb the tower as a part of their action @Check[athletics|dc:30]


8 Victory Points (2 for each lens)

  • 6 VP Threshold (Lower the DC of all Chase Phase checks by 1)

  • 4 VP Threshold (Lower the DC of all Chase Phase checks by 2

  • 2 VP Threshold (Lower the DC of all Chase Phase checks by 3)

Relevant Checks

  • Ranged Attack rolls DC 32

  • Melee Attack rolls DC 31

  • @Check[athletics|dc:30], @Check[thievery|dc:30]

  • @Check[occultism|dc:28], @Check[arcana|dc:30], @Check[religion|dc:30], @Check[nature|dc:30] (within 5 ft)

Modifies @UUID[JournalEntry.JT0zCcIwsSpKnbB5.JournalEntryPage.72MOBw46cojkIGrb]{E13. Gladiator Readiness Room}

Remove the mimic encounter from this room, and instead replace it with a mirror in the room (note not to read the part in the room description about the mimic). The mirror is the following haunt

@UUID[Actor.emEX7UJahRAIdKPv]{Ghost Queen's Reflection}

This was created by user Tight-Branch8678

Finding them

In the dining room as described there are a number of tapestries that are described as rotten and moldy. This addon seeks to use the option to restore them as a way to pass on information about some of the keep lore, as such they tell the story of Belcorra's life up to the completion of the Gauntlight.

There are 7 in total, corresponding to Nhimbaloth's favored number 7. Also of note this retcons Caliddo's connection to Belcorra from distant relative, to a first cousin.

Restoration

Inform players that these tapestries can be restored, either through someone who has specialization with canvas (Morliblint) or if a PC has a relevant skill (IE @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.QLeMH5mQgh28sa5o]{Specialty Crafting}: Artistry etc.). Regardless of the chosen method only one tapestry can be restored per day (having Morliblint do it would give the party a reason to return to Otari often, he does not charge for it but perhaps consider requiring them to be in his good graces first)

The Seven Tapestries

1. Birth

Trigger Warning: Human Sacrifice and Cannibalism

This tapestry depicts Belcorra as a babe in the arms of her mother. She does not weep, and instead looks into the stars through the ceiling. There is a prominent constellation of seven stars. The midwife and doctor lay dead on the ground, each with seven perfectly spaced incisions in the shape of a circle on their chests. Blood pools around the bed from other bodies in the periphery.

2. Human Sacrifice

Begin by saying that this tapestry depicts human sacrifice and cannibalism. Ask if they want more details below.

The tapestry depicts Belcorra as a toddler in a damp, moss-covered cavern. Coils of light (flicker wisps) light the interior. She stands watching several unfortunate souls who are being sacrificed/devoured while still alive. The Haruvexs' each are tormenting an individual; one forced to read The Whispering Reeds. Their face becoming stretched beyond comprehension, with their spirit splitting from their body, another impaled by a rod with seven points, and the last consumed by wild-eyed men and women.

3. Exile

The tapestry depicts a family sailing away from land. Their faces range from sorrow to anger and disdain. A young girl is the center of the tapestry she is the only one making eye contact with the viewer. There appears to be a dark ring about her head.

This tapestry shows the Haruvexs' exile from their home in Absalom.

A @Check[religion|dc:12] check indicates that the dark ring is a halo and represents a strong connection to divine entities. A critical success reveals that this halo represents a connection to a dark and evil deity.

4. Death and Poverty

The tapestry depicts Belcorra as a 17 year old. She is dressed in rags, but has a regal and defiant face. Surrounding Belcorra, her relatives lie in squalor and emaciated. She has her eyes on the horizon while everyone else has eyes only for the dirt beneath them. One other relative, wearing plate armor, looks to Belcorra with a look of loyalty. He appears as undead.

5. Visions from Nhimbaloth

Trigger Warning: Animal Sacrifice and Cruelty

The tapestry depicts Belcorra at 17 in winter apparel standing above a wild-eyed grizzly bear in the snow. A salmon tail is seen protruding from his mouth. The bear's entrails have splilled out from a massive wound in his belly. Fog escapes from the beast nostrils, indicating that he still lives. Belcorra is consuming a bit of the bear's flesh and looking at the blood of the beast pooling on the snowy ground. Within the pool of blood, Belcorra sees a vision of serpentfolk in a deep cavern constructing a shrine. Carved at the front of the shrine is a massive skull with moss jutting from the jaw. Beside this is another pool of blood with a vision of Belcorra building Gauntlight.periphery.

6. Return to Kortos

This tapestry depicts Belcorra at 17, sailing towards an island. The coastline is that of Otari before it had been settled. Cliffs and trees cover the island. Aboard the ship is an undead man clad in heavy armor.

7. Gauntlight Built

This tapestry shows the completion of Gauntlight being built. It glows with baleful light. Belcorra stands beside a drow man with his back facing the viewer, he has long silver hair. Beside him is a whirling ball of light and energy with floating eyes and tendrils each ending in 7 fingers. Standing near Belcorra is an undead clad in heavy armor. An enormous worm-like creature on dozens of legs stands next to the undead. It has an alchemical toolbelt around its body. Last is a red bodied man with large horns.

Volluk, the Voidglutton, Caliddo Harruvex, Jafaki, and Urevian are the figures standing around Belcorra.

This was created by user weepingminotaur

In this modification, Ysondkhelir fights the party in a dreamscape, allowing him more room to maneuver than in the tiny war room on floor G. Combat can trigger either when the party tries to open the door to G18, or after RP in Dorianna's chamber in town, as you prefer.

Ysondkhelir, in this dream sequence, is feeding on Dorianna's psychic energy, which makes him considerably more powerful than written in AV. The party will want to sever his link to Dorianna as soon as they can, using the Set Her Free activity below. Once his link is broken, he becomes far less powerful.

2 Set Her Free

Mental

spirit

Weaken Ysondkhelir's control on Dorianna with an appropriate skill check. A total of four successful checks are required to break control and set Dorianna free. Each skill can only be successfully used once. All checks are based on Ysondkhelir's level with the standard adjustments for difficulty.

  • Range The PC attempting the check must be adjacent to either Dorianna or Ysondkhelir. Other characters may use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} action to support a check but only if they are within 30 feet of Dorianna, Ysondkhelir, or the active PC (as appropriate for their action). A character cannot make a check or Aid if they are in a nightmare space.

  • Critical success Two successes.

  • Success One success.

  • Failure No change.

  • Critical failure The PC is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{stupefied 1}.

  • Arcana Use your knowledge of magic to weaken the spiritual link between Ysonkhelir and Dorianna.

    • @Check[type:Arcana|dc:31|traits:arcane,mental,spirit]{Arcana (Very Hard)}

  • Diplomacy Give Dorianna the courage to fight her tormentor.

    • @Check[type:Diplomacy|dc:28|traits:auditory,mental,spirit,visual|showDC:all]{Diplomacy (Hard)}

  • Intimidation Frighten the dream-catcher with threats of retribution.

    • @Check[type:Intimidation|dc:31|traits:auditory,mental,spirit|showDC:all]{Intimidation (Very Hard)}

  • Medicine Tend to Dorianna's wounds to restore her strength.

    • @Check[type:Medicine|dc:26|traits:manipulate,mental,spirit|showDC:all]{Medicine (Normal)}

  • Occultism Decipher the esoteric basis of Ysonkhelir's control over Dorianna.

    • @Check[type:Occultism|dc:26|traits:mental,occult,spirit|showDC:all]{Occultism (Normal)}

  • Society Remind Dorianna of her family and friends and her connection to Otari.

    • @Check[type:Society|dc:28|traits:auditory,mental,spirit|showDC:all]{Society (Hard)}

  • Spirit Lore Draw on your knowledge of the spiritual to bolster Dorianna in her fight against the dream-catcher.

    • @Check[type:Spirit-Lore|dc:24|traits:mental,spirit|showDC:all]{Spirit Lore (Easy)}

  • One success Ysondkhelir's resistance to physical damage drops to 5. The south section of his window wall disappears.

  • Two successes No more crawling hands can spawn. The north section of Ysondkhelir's window wall disappears.

  • Three successes Ysondkhelir is no longer quickened. The remaining sections of his window wall disappear.

  • Four successes Ysondkhelir loses his Attack of Opportunity and his resistance to physical damage. He also reverts to his normal size and loses 15 feet reach on melee strikes. Dorianna is temporarily free of his mental influence, though he will eventually reassert control if left alive.

Exiting the Dreamspace

Killing Ysondkhelir permanently sets Dorianna free and brings the party out of the dreamscape.

Agony In Every Breath

A PC who attempts to exit the dreamscape by the southern stairs can do so, but only after making a @Check[type:will|dc:26|showDC:all]{basic Will save} and take @Damage[(2d10+9)[spirit,mental]], Ysondkhelir is healed for the same amount of damage.
